item.description: The player gets D3 rerolls. Each reroll can be used to reroll one to-hit roll, to-wound roll, armour save, ward save or regeneration roll. Any rerolls not used at the end of the players turn are wasted.

item.name: Affiliation
item.description: Some Chaos units are devoted to one of the 4 Chaos deities (Khorne, Nurgle, Slaanesh and Tzeentch). The affiliation of a unit is determined either by its mark (e.g. Mark of Tzeentch) or name (e.g. Hellstriders of Slaanesh, Bloodletters of Khorne. Nurglings are affiliated with Nurgle.). All other units are considered to have no affiliation. Characters may only join units with the same affiliation as themselves or no affiliation, except for character models with no affiliation which are not restricted and free to join units independent of their affiliation.

item.name: Allure of Slaanesh
item.description: units in btb with one or more models with this gift suffer -1Ld

item.name: Ambush
item.description: If the army is led by a general from the Beastmen army list units with the Ambush special rule may start the game in reserve. Beginning with turn 2, roll a d6 at the start of your turn for each unit in reserve: on a 4+ the unit may enter the battlefield from any board edge (as if it has left the board in a previous turn due to a pursuit), add +1 to the roll for each turn after the second, a natural ‘1’ always fails.

item.name: Amulet of Chaos

If the target is immune to psychology all successful to-wound rolls have to be rerolled. This effect does not stop the model from using its Slythey Tounge attack.

item.name: Cygor
item.description: This model may reroll failed to-hit rolls against wizards, models with magic items or magic attacks, undead, or models with a ward save. In addition enemy wizards within 24" of one or more Cygors have to pass a Ld test at the start of each own magic phase. If failed all BM spells that the wizard fails to cast count as a Miscast in this magic phase. (A normal Miscast only counts once.)

item.name: Daemonic
item.description: - Cause Fear - Daemonic Ward Save (5+) - Immune to Psychology - Magical attacks - Instability: When a daemonic unit loses combat it has to take a break test with the following exceptions: - Flux Disruption: If the unit fails to pass its break test and the roll is equal to or less than the leadership of the unit, it suffers a number of wounds equal to the amount it failed the test by (no saves of any kind allowed). Character models in units are only affected if the unit is destroyed and there are unallocated wounds left. In this case wounds are distributed evenly between the character models (randomise odd wounds). - Warp Collapse: If the unit fails to pass its break test and the roll is higher than the leadership of the unit including any character models in the unit, it is destroyed Notes: - Ld-bonuses from characters and the Gold Your Ground! special rule can be used as normal. - Should a unit also benefit from Stubborn, it then does not suffer wounds because of Flux Disruption.

item.name: Daemonic Mount
item.description: - The model causes Fear - The mount has Daemonic Ward Save (5+) - The mount has Magical attacks - After the rider is slain the model is subject to the Daemonic special rules (see above)

item.name: Daemonic Pact
item.description: If the army is led by a general from the Daemons of Chaos list, then any daemonic units (but not characters), i.e. independent of their affiliation, may be included in the core warband (see Composition).

If failed, that model may not attack and all attacks against this model hit automatically that turn. (If used on a rank and file model, attacks need to be allocated. There is no overkill!). Has no effect on models that are immune to psychology.

item.name: Drunken
item.description: In the Start of the Turn phase roll a D6. On a roll of a 1 the unit gains the Stupidity special rule for this turn (test immediately). A roll of 2-5 has no effect. On a roll of a 6 the unit gains the Frenzy special rule (even if it lost its Frenzy in a previous turn) until the beginning of this units next turn or until it loses a combat.

item.description: Augment, Range 12", If the spell was cast successfully roll a D6 and consult the table below. The effect lasts until the casters next magic phase. A unit may only ever benefit of one Eye of the Gods effect at the same time, i.e. a second (or further) effect replaces the currently active effect. If the target consists of a unit with joined character models, only roll once and apply the result to all elements. If any element has the Favour of the Gods special rule then the roll may be modified by 1 once (i.e. independent of the actual number of Favours in the unit). 1: Immune to Psychology 2: Cause Fear (cause Terror if already cause fear) 3: AP (1) (cc and missile weapons) 4: unit rerolls 1s to hit (cc and missile weapons) 5: Poisoned Attacks (1) (cc and missile weapons) 6: +1 Toughness

item.name: Favour of the Gods
Favour of the Gods (c)
item.description: When the model is affected by the Eye of the Gods spell, it may modify its roll by 1.

item.name: Palanquin of Nurgle
item.description: The Palanquin is a common mount, i.e. it cannot be attacked, it grants a 6+AS to its rider, etc. In addition the model still counts as an infantry model with US1 and therefore cannot be singled out by shooting (under normal circumstances). Also when this model joins a unit, then the unit counts their rank bonus as if the space the Palanquin takes up was filled with rank and file models.

item.name: Power Vortex
item.description: During the Daemon players magic phase the model may give up wounds (no saves of any kind allowed) to generate D3 PD per wound which can only be used by this model.

item.name: Presence of Khorne
item.description: Friendly units with Frenzy within 6" of this model may take a Ld test at the start of their turn. Each unit that passes does not have to charge this turn. If this model is attached to the unit, make a single Ld test for this model and its unit.

item.name: Rivalry of the Gods
Daemonic Animosity
item.description: Units do not benefit from Inspiring Presence and Hold Your Ground! special rules if they are devoted to an opposing Chaos deity. Khorne and Slaanesh as well as Nurgle and Tzeentch count as opposing.

item.name: Rod of Corruption
item.description: PM 2/5+, Direct Damage, Range 18”, 3” template, S3, no AS. Target a point within the target unit. If the target point is out of range, the spell has no effect. If the target point is within range, place the template with its center over the target point and resolve it. A unit that suffers one or more casualties must take a panic test. One use only. (Nurgle only)

item.name: Rune of Binding
item.description: If the army is led by a general from the Warriors of Chaos list, this model gains the following benefits when it is within 12" of the army general: - It may use the WS of the general - It may take a Ld-Test at the start of the turn. If passed, the model does not have to attack due to Frenzy this turn.

item.name: Rune of the True Beast
item.description: Mounts and Monsters hit the bearer only on to-wound rolls of a natural 6.

item.name: Sceptre of Domination
item.description: PM 2/7+, Delectable Torture spell (Slaanesh only)

item.name: Siren Standard
item.description: Units charged by this unit can only choose “Hold" as a charge response.

item.name: Skull Banner
item.description: Units shooting at this unit suffer -1BS (to a minimum of 0) for this attack.

item.name: Skull Cannon
item.description: Cannon, Range 36", S10, no AS, D3 wounds, move or shoot, no stand and shoot

item.name: Skull Throne
item.description: Khorne units (including this model) within 6" of this model get one additional attack for each to-hit roll of a natural 6. These additional attacks cannot generate further attacks.

item.name: Skull of Katam
item.description: +1 to cast spells (PM/BM)

item.name: Slashing Attacks
item.description: This unit may attack a single enemy unit that it moved over in the Remaining Moves phase after it ended its move. The attacked unit suffers a number of S4 hits equal to the number of Screamer models in the unit. Hits are treated as close combat hits and distributed like shooting. Casualties caused in this way do not cause panic tests.

item.name: Slime Trail
item.description: Enemies fighting this model in cc do not gain bonuses for fighting in its flank or rear.

item.name: Slythey Tongue
item.description: Thrown weapon, Range 12", S5, Poisoned Attack (1)

item.name: Soporific Banner
item.description: The unit gains the Soporific Musk special rule.

item.name: Soporific Musk
item.description: Enemy units in btb contact with this unit roll one additional dice when they flee and discard the highest.

item.name: Soul Cleaver
item.description: Models wounded (after saves) must pass a T-test or suffer 1 additional wound (no saves of any kind allowed)

item.name: Soul Hunger
item.description: Model rerolls failed to-wound rolls.

item.name: Soulthirster
item.description: Roll a die for each model killed: regain 1W for each 6 rolled (up to starting wounds). Immediately roll when a model is killed and apply the result.

item.name: Spell Destroyer
item.description: Dispel Scroll. On a 4+ BM / 5+ PM the spell is destroyed. One use only.

item.name: Spellcaster
item.description: - this unit may cast one of the following spells in each magic phase: - Pink Flames of Tzeentch (PM X/4+): MM, Range 24", D6+2 S3 hits, AP (1) - Pink Transmutation (PM X/4+): each enemy model in btb with this unit suffers a S4 hit, for each unsaved wound caused in this way add a model to this unit (up to the max. unit size). - The number of casting dice X depends on the size of this unit (including character models): - 1-9 models: X=1 - 10-14 models: X=2 - 15-19 models: X=3 - 20+ models: X=4 - Spells cannot be lost through a miscast

item.name: Spelleater Shield
item.description: Shield, MR2. Any spell that targets the bearer (or his unit) that is dispelled is destroyed on a D6 roll of a 4+. In addition the model may attempt to dispel spells that target itself (or his unit) as if it was a wizard. (Khorne only)

item.name: Spurting Bile-Blood
item.description: For each wound the model loses in cc, the unit that inflicted the wound suffers a S5 hit that is allocated like shooting and counts toward combat resolution.

item.name: Staff of Change
item.description: Once per magic phase the model may reroll a single dice when casting a spell (BM and PM). Can prevent miscasts and cause irresistible force. (Tzeentch only)

item.name: Staff of Darkoth
item.description: Counts as a hand weapon with magical attacks. In addition the bearer gains the The Wild Call PM 2/5+ spell: Augment, may be cast on any infantry unit of Gor, Bestigor or Ungor or any unit of Chaoshounds within 12", the target unit may immediately move up D6+1" but may not charge.

item.name: Staff of Nurgle
item.description: PM 2/8+, Effulgent Boils spell

item.name: Staff of Sorcery
item.description: +1 to total roll to attempt to dispel a spell.

item.name: Stalwart
item.description: The unit rerolls failed panic tests.

item.name: Stream of Bile
item.description: Breath weapon, S4

item.name: Stream of Corruption
item.description: Breath weapon, S3

item.name: Sword of Change
item.description: Every time a character model or a monster is slain by this sword, roll a D6. On a 4+ a Chaos Spawn with D3 wounds comes into play under the control of the Chaos player. The Chaos Spawn model has to be placed within 6" of the bearer of this sword and no closer than 1" to enemy units. If the model cannot be placed it counts as destroyed. Chaos Spawns generated by this sword are worth no VP. (Tzeentch only)

item.name: Tentacles
item.description: Model in btb loses 1A, Chaos player may choose which model and which attack

item.name: The Black Tongue
item.description: The bearer takes a wound (no saves of any kind allowed) to convert an enemies failed casting into a miscast (PM and BM).

item.name: The Dark Heart
item.description: Bearer and the unit it is with gain +1M.

item.name: The Fur of Sharrgu
item.description: +2AS vs ranged attacks

item.name: The Goretooth
item.description: The bearer gains the Hatred and Bloodgreed special rules. If the bearer is part of a unit, then the unit is affected by Bloodgreed as well. In addition the bearer gains the The Bears Anger PM 2/5+ spell: Augment, cast on itself or friendly character model on foot with US1 (in both cases) within 12", the target gains +2A, +1S and +1T but cannot wield a weapon nor use a shield. Lasts until the casters next magic phase.

item.name: The Plague Chalice
item.description: The bearer may use this item in any magic phase and suffers immediately a S4 hit with no saves of any kind allowed. In that magic phase all successful casting rolls by the bearer of BM spells that include any double and are not miscasts counts as cast with irresistible force. One use only. (Nurgle only)

item.name: Throw Rocks
item.description: Catapult, Range 6"-36", 3" Template, S4(8), no AS, D3 wounds, no stand and shoot, may move and shoot but the model is only allowed to use its BS when it stayed stationary. In the case of a misfire the model suffers 1 wound and does not shoot this turn.

item.name: Tormentor
item.description: One model of the Daemon players choice in btb with the model takes a Ld test at the start of each cc phase. If failed victim has to attack his own unit or any model in btb contact (Daemon players choice). Wounds inflicted count for combat resolution. Has no effect on models that are Immune to Psychology. If there are no legal targets, the model does not attack at all.

item.name: Trample
item.description: A model with this special rule gets +1A at base strength that is not affected by weapon bonuses or penalties.

item.name: Troll Vomit
item.description: Instead of attacking normally, the unit may decide to use their special vomit attack: each model causes 1 S5 hit with no AS to one enemy model it is in btb with.

item.name: Trollhide
item.description: Regeneration (6+)

item.name: Tusker Charge
item.description: This unit gains +2S in the turn it charged.

item.name: Twin Heads
item.description: +2 to cast spells (PM/BM)

item.name: Twisted Reality
item.description: Spell Ranges increased by 6", has no effect on spells without range

item.name: Tzeentchs Blessing
item.description: Model ignores all miscast effects (i.e. the casting still fails but do not roll on the miscast table).

item.name: Tzeentchs Chosen
item.description: Model may reroll a single dice per game. (to-hit, towound, saving throw, characteristic test (inlc. Ld), casting and dispelling).

item.name: Tzeentchs Will
item.description: Model may reroll a single dice per turn. (to-hit, towound, saving throw, characteristic test (inlc. Ld), casting and dispelling).

item.name: Uncontrollable
item.description: At the start of each turn that the model is not already in close combat, it has to pass as Ld-Test. If the test is failed the model suffers from Frenzy until it passes its Uncontrollable test or loses combat. Note that it is possible for the model to regain Frenzy even if it lost it in cc before.

item.name: Unreliable
item.description: This unit has to roll on its misfire chart if it suffers a misfire.

item.name: Upgrade Level 2 Wizard
Upgrade Level 2 wizard
item.description: Model becomes a Level 2 wizard.

item.name: Vitriolic Banner
item.description: The unit gains the Poisoned Attacks (1) special rule (cc as well as shooting). Has no effect on magic items.

item.name: War Banner
item.description: +1CR

item.name: Warp Catapult
item.description: Catapult, Range 6"-36", 3" Template, S4(8), no AS, D3 wounds, no stand and shoot, may move and shoot but the model is only allowed to use its BS when it stayed stationary. Misfire: weapon does not fire and model suffers one wound (no saves allowed).

item.name: Warrior Familiar
item.description: At the start of each cc round (Timing step 1) the Warrior Familiar inflicts one S5 hit against an enemy model in btb with the bearer.

item.name: Warshrine
item.description: - This model may cast the Eye of the Gods (PM 3/5+) spell. In addition, roll two dice instead of one and choose which one result to apply. If you roll a double, you may pick any result. - This spell cannot be lost through a miscast.

item.name: Whip of Pleasure
item.description: Counts as additional hand weapons and grants ASF (Slaanesh only)

item.name: Will of Chaos
item.description: If the army is led by a general from the Warriors of Chaos list, all Warriors of Chaos units reroll failed panic tests. If the army general is a Daemon Prince, then its warband determines which list it was chosen from and only the respective special rule applies for the army.

item.name: Winged Horror
item.description: The model can fly and counts as a Flying Model.

item.name: RX
item.description: Daemonic Gifts
